description.narrative: Project development objective is to improve the management and operations of the cash social assistance programs and to improve the access to and quality of social care services.

condition.narrative: (b) A Special Tender Committee (STC) headed by the Secretary General of MoSD will be established at the Ministry of SocialDevelopment
(d) Not later than April 30, 2009, the Recipient shall appoint an auditor for the Project, acceptable to the Bank.
The Borrower through the PISU, shall prepare detailed Annual Project Implementation Plans and submit them for the IBRD#s reviewnotlater than December 1 of each year of Project implementation

title.narrative: Pilot integrated social work and care centres functional and adequately funded by government

target.value: 3 social work and care centers use integrated model

comment.narrative: A consulting firm was hired to work with MOSD on the ISSCs. The firm finalized the locations of each center, identified thepriority areas and services needed in each center, determined the main target groups and designed the centers accordingly. Thethree ISSC are expected to be fully operational by beginning 2012

title.narrative: NAF database includes 80% of poor households based on new targeting mechanism
Survey of user satisfaction of NAF and MoSD services
At least 50% of NAF beneficiaries use smart cards to collect assistance
Percentage of people benefitting from social work and care services in pilot districts.

comment.narrative: Technical work and implementation of the pilot centers are underway but too early to measure their impact.

title.narrative: MoSD adopts a Strategic Development Plan and Human Resources Development Strategy

target.value: Strategic Development Plan and Human Resources Development Strategy validated

comment.narrative: Strategic Development Plan has been adopted. Human Resource Strategy is still under preparation.

The Strategic Development Plan and Human Resource Strategy assignments are expected to start in 2012 and in the first quarter ofFY12 respectively thus it is too early to measure progress towards adaptation by MOSD.

title.narrative: Pilot residential insitutions transformed to resemble a family like setting

comment.narrative: The consulting firm that will implement the new #Family-based model# has been identified. Two centers are already operating andthethird center is expected to be fully operational by October 2011.

title.narrative: Pilot resource and information centres for persons with disability operational and adequately funded by government

target.value: 3 pilot centers fully functional and funded by government

comment.narrative: The firm that will rehabilitate the centers has been selected and will start working on the three centers in August 2011.

title.narrative: NAF program coverage of targeted poor

comment.narrative: Cabinet decision is pending to empower the NAF to proceed with the implementation of the new targeting mechanism but the followingtechnical tasks have been completed: (i) completion of a pilot involving about 7500 households; (ii) updating of the PMT targetingformula utilizing the 2008 HIES; and (iii) revisions of the PMT and NAF questionnaires.

title.narrative: M&E unit in MOSD issues its annual report

target.value: M&E unit established and issues its first annual M&E reports

comment.narrative: The process of establishing M&E unit still underway.
A local firm has been selected to design and implement the M&E system, however, the signature of the Minister of SocialDevelopmentis still pending

title.narrative: Department of Statistics uses standard software packages for statistical data analysis and management

comment.narrative: STATA and SPSS software licenses have been purchased and staff trained. PDAs were purchased and will be used for data entry onincome and expenditure surveys. The training needs have been identified and are expected to be delivered in 2011.The project willalso equip a multi-purpose training center at DOS and MOSD.
